DataElement.preferredName: No Voluntary Movement Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score Assessment Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the no voluntary movement neurologic function scale domain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: No Voluntary Movement Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Of your own free will or design; not forced or compelled; controlled by individual volition._A change in location or position._A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Neurologic Function Scale Assessment Score Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A 25-point scale used to evaluate the severity of gross neurologic dysfunction by scoring 15 disabilities across multiple domains._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
